body:
Sure, it's a fine piece of advice, but it seems out of place here in the documentation for `Dataset.shard()`.

Perhaps moving it to the `Dataset.shuffle()` docstring would make sense? Or else there might be a [spot in the programmer's guide](https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/datasets#randomly_shuffling_input_data) where the point could be driven home? (Also, rather than pointing to the `tf.contrib.data.shuffle_and_repeat()` API, which is going to be deprecated along with the rest of `tf.contrib` soon, maybe just say "apply `shuffle()` before `repeat()` if this is undesirable."
